title: Mourning the death of Angeline Marie Testani Schleider, distinguished citizen and devoted member of her community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  mourning  the  death  of Angeline Marie Testani
Schleider, distinguished citizen and devoted member of her community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  pay  tribute  to
citizens  of  the  State  of  New York whose lifework and civic endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Angeline Marie Testani Schleider died on Sunday, January  23,
2011, at the age of 85; and
  WHEREAS, She took great pride in being the oldest of nine children and
after  the  passing of her parents, she was known to refer to herself as
the "Matriarch Number 1 Testani"; and
  WHEREAS, Angeline Marie Schleider distinguished herself in her profes-
sion and by her sincere dedication and substantial contribution  to  the
welfare of her community; and
  WHEREAS, She was an extremely hard worker all of her life and had been
employed  by  many  companies,  including EJ Corporation, Link Aviation,
General Electric and retired from IBM; and
  WHEREAS, Up until 2010, Angeline Marie Schleider enjoyed  hosting  the
traditional  family  Christmas  Eve dinner; she loved cooking and making
homemade pasta to share with family and friends; every year,  she  would
donate her delicious baked goods to St. Mary's Easter Bake Sale; and
  WHEREAS,  Angeline Marie Schleider also took pleasure in hosting trips
as "Angie's Tours" with the motto "Anytime, Anywhere, Any place"; and
  WHEREAS, Angeline Marie Schleider's commitment to excellence, and  her
spirit  of humanity, carried over into all fields of enterprise, includ-
ing charitable and civic endeavors; and
  WHEREAS, This remarkable octogenarian was a  lifelong  member  of  St.
Mary  of  the  Assumption  Church and enjoyed volunteering at its Annual
bazaar; she was a proud member of the Stella D'Argenta Lodge  where  she
cooked many meals, as well as St. Mary's Golden Age Club and the Cathol-
ic Daughters; and
  WHEREAS,  Predeceased  by  her husband, Edward Schleider; her parents,
Arthur and Mary Testani; one brother, Querino Testani; three sisters-in-
law, Peggy Testani, Marian Burke, and Helen Cacala;  three  brothers-in-
law,  Paul  Kochis, Jack Schleider, and Frank Schleider; and one nephew,
Robert John Testani, Angeline Marie Schleider is survived by her  daugh-
ters,  Mary Frances Testani (Gerald) DuBrava and Angela Schleider Testa-
ni; one son, Edward (Sandy) Schleider; grandchildren, Lisa Marie  (Greg)
Morrison,  Angeline Rose Testani, Jacqueline Lewis, Christie and Michael
Schleider, and Elizabeth Ann Rifenbury; two great-grandchildren, Chelsea
Ann Lewis and Zachary Tyler Rifenbury; brothers, Richard "Ritzi" (Betty)
Testani, Nicholas (Joanne) Testani, Anthony "Chick" (Marjorie)  Testani,
and  Arthur  (Josephine)  Testani; sisters, Frances Kochis, Anna (Frank)
DiStefano, and  Barbara  (Anthony)  Fiala;  and  sisters-in-law,  Sister
Beverly  Schleider, and Betty Pantalone; as well as many nieces, nephews
and cousins; and
  WHEREAS, Armed with a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with  a  sense  of
compassion,  and  comforted by a loving family, Angeline Marie Schleider
leaves behind a legacy which will long endure the passage  of  time  and
will  remain  as  a  comforting memory to all she served and befriended;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
mourn the death of Angeline Marie Testani Schleider, distinguished citi-
zen and devoted member of her community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of Angeline Marie Testani Schleider.
